title: Elementary properties
content: Remark: to represent odd prime numbers, i.e., all prime numbers except ` 2 `, the idiom ` P e. ( Prime \ { 2 } ) ` is used. It is a little bit shorter than ` ( P e. Prime /\ P =/= 2 ) `. Both representations can be converted into each other by ~ eldifsn .

blocks.name: cprime
blocks.content: Extend the definition of a class to include the set of prime numbers.
blocks.origin: const class cprime { Prime }

blocks.name: diff.cprime.s
diff.cprime.c
diff.cprime.w
df-prm
blocks.content: Define the set of prime numbers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: isprm
blocks.content: The predicate "is a prime number". A prime number is a positive integer with exactly two positive divisors. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm isprm(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cprime), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), cen, c2o)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  elrab2(hs0, c0, cprime, cn, wbr(crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), cen, c2o), wbr(crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cen, c2o))
  breq1d(crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cen, c2o, crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabbidv(s0, cn, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cdvds)
  df-prm(hs0, s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), cen, c2o))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: prmnn
blocks.content: A prime number is a positive integer. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: prmz
blocks.content: A prime number is an integer. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Proof shortened by Jonathan Yan, 16-Jul-2017.)

blocks.name: prmssnn
blocks.content: The prime numbers are a subset of the positive integers. (Contributed by AV, 22-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: prmex
blocks.content: The set of prime numbers exists. (Contributed by AV, 22-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: 0nprm
blocks.content: 0 is not a prime number. Already the definition ~ df-prm excludes 0 from being prime ( ` Prime = { p e. NN | ... ` ), but even if ` p e. NN0 ` was allowed, the condition ` { n e. NN | n || p } ~~ 2o ` would not hold for ` p = 0 ` , because ` { n e. NN | n || 0 } = NN ` , see ~ dvds0 , and ` -. NN ~~ 2o ` (there are more than 2 positive integers). (Contributed by AV, 29-May-2023.)

blocks.name: 1nprm
blocks.content: 1 is not a prime number. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Proof shortened by Fan Zheng, 3-Jul-2016.)

blocks.name: isprm2
blocks.content: The predicate "is a prime number". A prime number is an integer greater than or equal to 2 whose only positive divisors are 1 and itself. Definition in [ApostolNT] p. 16. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 26-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: isprm4

blocks.name: prmind2
blocks.content: A variation on ~ prmind assuming complete induction for primes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)

thm prmind2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4, wff w5) {

  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cmul, cv(s2))), wb(w1, w5))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))

  -| wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, nat2))), wi(wa(w3, w4), w5))

blocks.name: prmind
blocks.content: Perform induction over the multiplicative structure of ` NN ` . If a property ` ph ( x ) ` holds for the primes and ` 1 ` and is preserved under multiplication, then it holds for every positive integer. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm prmind(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4, wff w5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), w0)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wb(w1, w2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w3))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wb(w1, w4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cmul, cv(s2))), wb(w1, w5))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w1, w0))
  -| w2
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), cprime), w1)
  -| wi(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(s2), cfv(cuz, nat2))), wi(wa(w3, w4), w5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w5)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w3)
} = {
  prmind2(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4, w5)
  adantr(wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wral(s1, co(nat1, cfz, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), w3), w1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm prmind(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3, wff w4, wff w5) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚Üí w0)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = 1 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w2))
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w3))
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s2 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w4))
  ‚ä£ (s0 =(s1[√ó]s2)‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w5))
  ‚ä£ (s0 = c0 ‚Üí(w1 ‚Üî w0))
  ‚ä£ w2
  ‚ä£ (s0 ‚àà Prime ‚Üí w1)
  ‚ä£ ((s1 ‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2)‚àß s2 ‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2))‚Üí((w3 ‚àß w4)‚Üí w5))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w3)
} = {
  prmind2(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0, w1, w2, w3, w4, w5)
  adantr(s0 ‚àà Prime, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà(1[...](s0[-]1)), w3), w1)
}

blocks.name: dvdsprime
blocks.content: If ` M ` divides a prime, then ` M ` is either the prime or one. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 8-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvdsprime(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wb(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(c1, c0), wceq(c1, nat1))))

  rspccva(hs0, cn, c1, wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))), wi(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(c1, c0), wceq(c1, nat1))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(c1, c0), wceq(c1, nat1)))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, cdvds, c0)
  syl6bb(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wo(wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wo(wceq(c1, c0), wceq(c1, nat1)), wo(wceq(c1, nat1), wceq(c1, c0)))
  orbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), nat1), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(c1, nat1), wceq(c1, c0))
  eqeq1(cv(hs0), c1, nat1)

  jaod(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(c1, c0), wceq(c1, nat1), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(c1, c0), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wbr(c0, cdvds, c0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, cdvds, c0))

  iddvds(c0)
  breq1(c1, c0, cdvds, c0)
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(c1, nat1), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wbr(nat1, cdvds, c0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(nat1, cdvds, c0))

blocks.name: nprm

thm nprm(class c0, class c1) {

  simprbi(wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cprime), wral(hs0, cfv(cuz, nat2), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c0, cmul, c1)))), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cfv(cuz, nat2)))

  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c0, cmul, c1)), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c0, cmul, c1)), wceq(c0, co(c0, cmul, c1)))

  simprbi((c0[√ó]c1)‚àà Prime, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2),(hs0[||](c0[√ó]c1)‚Üí hs0 =(c0[√ó]c1))), (c0[√ó]c1)‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2))

blocks.name: nprmi
blocks.content: An inference for compositeness. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Feb-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm nprmi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wn(wcel(c0, cprime))
  -| wcel(c1, cn)
  -| wcel(c2, cn)
  -| wbr(nat1, clt, c1)
  -| wbr(nat1, clt, c2)
  -| wceq(co(c1, cmul, c2), c0)
} = {
  mtbi(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cprime))
  mp4an(wn(wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cprime)), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c1), wcel(c2, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c2))
  syl2anbr(wa(wcel(c1, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c1)), wa(wcel(c2, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, cmul, c2), cprime)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c2, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  eluz2b2(c1)
  eluz2b2(c2)
  nprm(c1, c2)
  eleq1i(co(c1, cmul, c2), cprime, c0)
}

  ‚ä£ 1[<]c2

  syl2anbr((c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß 1[<]c1), (c2 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚àß 1[<]c2), ¬¨(c1[√ó]c2)‚àà Prime, c1 ‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2), c2 ‚àà(‚Ñ§‚â• ` 2))

blocks.name: dvdsnprmd
blocks.content: If a number is divisible by an integer greater than 1 and less than the number, the number is not prime. (Contributed by AV, 24-Jul-2021.)

  -| wi(w0, wbr(nat1, clt, c1))

  mpd(w0, wn(wcel(c0, cprime)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0))

  divides(hs0, c1, c0)

  syl2anc(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cz)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, c1), c0)), wn(wcel(co(cv(hs0), cmul, c1), cprime)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  syl3anbrc(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cz)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, c1), c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(nat2, cz), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wbr(nat2, cle, cv(hs0)))
  a1i(wa(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cz)), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, c1), c0)), wcel(nat2, cz))
  simplr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, c1), c0))

blocks.name: prm2orodd
blocks.content: A prime number is either 2 or odd. (Contributed by AV, 19-Jun-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm prm2orodd(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cprime), wo(wceq(c0, nat2), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0))))
} = {
  orrd(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(c0, nat2), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0)))
  con3d(wcel(c0, cprime), wceq(c0, nat2), wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0), wceq(c0, nat2), wo(wceq(nat2, c0), wceq(nat2, nat1)))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cprime), wb(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c0), wo(wceq(nat2, c0), wceq(nat2, nat1))), wcel(nat2, cn))
  2nn()
  dvdsprime(c0, nat2)
  jaoi(wceq(nat2, c0), wceq(nat2, nat1), wceq(c0, nat2))
  biimpi(wceq(nat2, c0), wceq(c0, nat2))
  eqcom(nat2, c0)
  ax-mp(wi(wceq(nat2, nat1), wceq(c0, nat2)), wne(nat1, nat2))
  1ne2()
  sylbi(wne(nat1, nat2), wi(wceq(nat2, nat1), wceq(c0, nat2)), wne(nat2, nat1))
  necom(nat1, nat2)
  com12(wne(nat2, nat1), wceq(nat2, nat1), wceq(c0, nat2))
  eqneqall(nat2, nat1, wceq(c0, nat2))
}

blocks.name: 2prm

blocks.name: 2mulprm
blocks.content: A multiple of two is prime iff the multiplier is one. (Contributed by AV, 8-Jun-2030.)

blocks.name: ge2nprmge4
blocks.content: A composite integer greater than or equal to ` 2 ` is greater than or equal to ` 4 ` . (Contributed by AV, 5-Jun-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm ge2nprmge4(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wnel(c0, cprime)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat4)))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wnel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat4)))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat4))), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)))
  eluz2b2(c0)
  syl6ibr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat4)), w3a(wcel(nat4, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime), w3a(wcel(nat4, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  3jca(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime)), wcel(nat4, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat4, cle, c0))
  a1i(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime)), wcel(nat4, cz))
  4z()
  ad2antrr(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0), wnel(c0, cprime), wcel(c0, cz))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0))
  imp(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  sylbid(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wbr(nat2, cle, c0))
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat1, clt, c0), wbr(nat2, cle, c0), wbr(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, c0))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wbr(nat1, clt, c0), wbr(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, c0)), wcel(nat1, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  1z()
  zltp1le(nat1, c0)
  breq1i(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, c0, nat2)
  1p1e2()
  sylbid(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat2, cle, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wo(wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wceq(nat2, c0)))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wbr(nat2, cle, c0), wo(wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wceq(nat2, c0))), wcel(nat2, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  2re()
  leloe(nat2, c0)
  jaod(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wceq(nat2, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  sylbid(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wbr(nat3, cle, c0))
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wbr(nat3, cle, c0), wbr(co(nat2, caddc, nat1), cle, c0))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wbr(nat2, clt, c0), wbr(co(nat2, caddc, nat1), cle, c0)), wcel(nat2, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  2z()
  zltp1le(nat2, c0)
  breq1i(co(nat2, caddc, nat1), cle, c0, nat3)
  2p1e3()
  sylbid(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, cle, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wo(wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wceq(nat3, c0)))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wbr(nat3, cle, c0), wo(wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wceq(nat3, c0))), wcel(nat3, cr), wcel(c0, cr))
  3re()
  nnre(c0)
  leloe(nat3, c0)
  jaod(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wceq(nat3, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)))
  a1d(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, clt, c0)), wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0))
  syl5eqbr(nat4, cle, c0, co(nat3, caddc, nat1), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, clt, c0)))
  df-4()
  biimpa(wcel(c0, cn), wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wbr(co(nat3, caddc, nat1), cle, c0))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wbr(nat3, clt, c0), wbr(co(nat3, caddc, nat1), cle, c0)), wcel(nat3, cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  3z()
  nnz(c0)
  zltp1le(nat3, c0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cn), wi(wceq(nat3, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0))))
  sylbid(wceq(nat3, c0), wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0), wnel(nat3, cprime))
  eqcoms(nat3, c0, wb(wnel(c0, cprime), wnel(nat3, cprime)))
  neleq1(c0, nat3, cprime)
  mp1i(wceq(nat3, c0), wi(wnel(nat3, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wcel(nat3, cprime))
  3prm()
  elnelall(nat3, cprime, wbr(nat4, cle, c0))
  a1i(wcel(c0, cn), wi(wceq(nat2, c0), wi(wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0))))
  sylbid(wceq(nat2, c0), wnel(c0, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0), wnel(nat2, cprime))
  eqcoms(nat2, c0, wb(wnel(c0, cprime), wnel(nat2, cprime)))
  neleq1(c0, nat2, cprime)
  mp1i(wceq(nat2, c0), wi(wnel(nat2, cprime), wbr(nat4, cle, c0)), wcel(nat2, cprime))

blocks.name: sqnprm
blocks.content: A square is never prime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqnprm(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cz), wn(wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
} = {
  pm2.65da(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime), wcel(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), cprime))

  eqtr3d(co(c0, cexp, nat2), co(cfv(cabs, c0), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  sqvald(cfv(cabs, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  recnd(cfv(cabs, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wn(wcel(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cmul, cfv(cabs, c0)), cprime)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cz), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(cabs, c0)))
  nn0zd(cfv(cabs, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cn0))
  nn0abscl(c0)
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(cabs, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, cexp, nat2), clt, co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2)))
  syl5eqbr(co(nat1, cexp, nat2), clt, co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), nat1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  sq1()
  breqtrrd(nat1, clt, co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cexp, nat2), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wbr(nat1, clt, co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  prmuz2(co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  eluz2gt1(co(c0, cexp, nat2))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2), co(c0, cexp, nat2)), wcel(c0, cr))
  absresq(c0)
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)), wb(wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(cabs, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, cexp, nat2), clt, co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2))), wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cabs, c0)))
  abscld(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  absge0d(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  recnd(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(co(c0, cexp, nat2), cprime), wcel(c0, cr))
  zre(c0)
  mpanl12(wa(wcel(cfv(cabs, c0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(cabs, c0))), wb(wbr(nat1, clt, cfv(cabs, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, cexp, nat2), clt, co(cfv(cabs, c0), cexp, nat2))), wcel(nat1, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, nat1))
  1re()
  0le1()

blocks.name: dvdsprm

blocks.name: prmdvdsfz
blocks.content: Each integer greater than 1 and less then or equal to a fixed number is divisible by a prime less then or equal to this fixed number. (Contributed by AV, 15-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

  mpd(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wrex(s0, cprime, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cle, c0), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c1))), wrex(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c1)))

  syl2anr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, co(nat2, cfz, c0))), wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wi(wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c1), wbr(cv(s0), cle, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(c1, cn))

blocks.name: nprmdvds1
blocks.content: No prime number divides 1. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)

blocks.name: isprm5

blocks.name: isprm7
blocks.content: One need only check prime divisors of ` P ` up to ` sqrt P ` in order to ensure primality. This version of ~ isprm5 combines the primality and bound on ` z ` into a finite interval of prime numbers. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 20-Jan-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: maxprmfct
blocks.content: The set of prime factors of an integer greater than or equal to 2 satisfies the conditions to have a supremum, and that supremum is a member of the set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.)
